modName: Batch Files for Adding Armors to Game
summary: This collection of .bat files will enable you to quickly add sets of Nexus user created armors.
descriptionHtml:
My goal is this, to simplify testing and previewing user made armors in the game without having to tab in and out of the game to a website page in-order to put in a code character by character just to preview a set of armor to see if one likes it. I apologize for the amateurishness of this mod, but I figure if I wanna break onto the scene, I might as well start small and contribute in my own way. Especially since Nexus really helped me get the most out of Skyrim.

To this end, I have figured the best way to go about doing this, is to create .bat files of as many sets of armor as I can, that are nexus created. I\'m not really one for writing descriptions of something, so let me just jump right in to installation, running \".bats\" and things worth mentioning.

I) [u] Special Information: [/u]
           I need to mention this first and foremost because it is absolutely crucial to this mod: !!!! YOU MUST HAVE DOWNLOADED THE PROPER ORIGINAL FILES FROM THE ORIGINAL AUTHOR OF THE ARMOR/CLOTHING MOD !!!! I will provide links, descriptions and (possibly if I have enough time) reviews of armor sets. I\'m not stealing any of the authors work, I\'m simply making it easier to obtain the items in-game without jumping through a bunch of hoops so those that want to add the armor to their characters instantly, can.

     [b][color=red]    If any Author of any Armor/Clothing mod disapproves of having a .bat created of their armor, please PM me and I will remove that batch file as soon as I see your PM.[/color][color=green] If any author would like to have their armors added to a .bat file same method applies with a few tweaks, you\'ll have to provide me a link to your armor on the Nexus site. I will only be working with Nexus site armors, sorry. [/color][/b]

For now, I\'ll only be adding 1 armor set which is by Gyo. The set is titled [b]Psiijic Re-Skin several versions[/b]
The set is found at this link within the Nexus site: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/1854/?tab=1&navtag=%2Fajax%2Fmoddescription%2F%3Fid%3D1854%26preview%3D&pUp=1]Psiijic Re-Skin Several Versions[/url]

Download that mod, via NMM and follow whatever installation instructions they have included. [b][color=red]Warning! I cannot help you if you do not follow the Armor/Clothing Mod Authors instructions[/color][/b]

Now onto the instructions for my Mod.

Installation:
1) Click the downloads tab on this page and select the \"PRobes.txt\" file. 
2) Choose to download \"PRobes.txt\" file manually.
3) Find out what directory you have installed Skyrim in.
        [b]Steam:[/b] C:\\Program Files\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
        [b]Non-Steam:[/b] 
              C:\\Program Files\\Bethesda Softworks\\The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim 
                             [b]or[/b]
                        C:\\Program Files\\The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
4) Place \"PRobes.txt\" into your Skyrim directory, [color=red]NOT[/color] your Data Folder.
5) Launch Skyrim through whatever means you use.
6) Press the ` key on your keyboard to bring up the console in game once you\'ve loaded up entirely.
7) Type in [color=green] bat PRobes.txt[/color] EXACTLY like that.
8) Press enter.
9) Close your console menu.
10) Enjoy! You now own a full set of retextured Psiijic Order armor by Gyo, all without having to tab in and out of game to type in the codes to obtain it!

Final Thoughts:
If you like the armors featured here, ENDORSE the original Mod Authors page. In this case for example, if you like what Gyo did, endorse his work!
Again, I have not stolen any authors works, all I have done is compiled a batch to simply add these items into your inventory through one simple command via in-game Console.

Planned Sets to Come:
Black Mage Armor, Author Reko found [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9645/?] here[/url]
Drakul/Medusa Armor, Author Zerofrost Satyr found [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/31229/?] here[/url]

These won\'t be done until I manage to PM Reko and Zerofrost and get a response. Right now I\'m testing the waters with this type of modification and seeing if its something people would actually like.
author: Caedes
